headline: Mississippi Roast (Slow Cooker Pepperoncini Pot Roast)
description: Mississippi pepperoncini roast — cooked with ranch and au jus mix along with pepperoncini peppers, of course, is an easy, zesty slow cooker recipe.
name: Mississippi Roast (Slow Cooker Pepperoncini Pot Roast)
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 ounce) packet dry au jus mix

recipeInstructions.text: Place roast in a slow cooker. Form a pocket in the top of the roast and place butter, pepperoncini peppers, ranch dressing mix, and au jus mix in the pocket.

review.reviewBody: I made this a few weeks ago as written, except I omitted the peppers thinking it would be too hot. It was good, but very very salty. I am trying it today with 1/2 pk. of brown gravy mix, all the pk. ranch, peppers and butter. So we will see… My second try came out great, I even added onion, celery and potatoes! It was delicious.
This is an excellent Recipe and so easy.

After years of wasting pot roasts that my family doesn't like, this is the only one I make. Depending on the size of roast, 1/4 to 1/2 cup of butter, I buy a low sodium brown gravy mix & leave the peppers whole, no one eats them after they are cooked, but I pour some of the juice in the pot & cook it on high....house smells amazing & it gets eaten. I don't make gravy, it's tender and doesn't need it, so I freeze the liquid to use in the next roast....saves on butter

I've made this many times. The only change is that I add the entire 12 oz bottle of Pepperoncini and 1/4 cup of the juice. We don't eat it as a roast dinner. I shred the meat and pepperoncici (stems removed), put the meat on large onion rolls and top it with cole slaw. Delicious!!!
I added more pepperoncini's. It's a fantastic recipe. Sometimes I make it with homemade dumplings, rice and potatoes are great too.

If you own a crockpot and can open a few packages, you're 8 hours away from a delicate, rich full flavor roast. I cooked mine 10 hours on the lowest setting. Literally had to spoon it out of the crockpot. Served it with creamy mashed potatoes and a tossed salad for Sunday dinner. The discussion is already on about the endless use of leftovers. Best part, it's affordable.
Sounds weird, tastes amazing. Make this once a week for my sons who never want pot roast any other way. So simple and so delish!
Recipe is the greatest - I always have to look it up because I can't remember the simple ingredients - tastes wonderful. My very picky eater husband thought it was great!!!
Maybe I missed something , extremely salty no juice

Had the same recipe from my Recipe which also add some of the pepper juice. Also use a pork loin. Very good- ate too much. Will definitely make it again. May try it with beef stew meat and add some carrots. Love the bit of spice kick

Excellent. I changed everything except the slow-cooker.:-} Used 2 smaller London Broils, bottled ranch, crushed beef bullion cubes for the au jus. Sliced banana peppers w/ about 1/3 jar of the juice. Also did 4 hrs high. Cut "like butta..."

Awesome! I added a few twists. Instead of browning the meat on the stove, I seared the meat on my outdoor grill giving it that open flame flavor. Taking a que from another poster I sprayed the crockpot with olive oil non stick spray and lightly coated the top of the meat with garlic powder. I also used a 12 oz jar of chopped peppers which eliminated the need to remove the stems and seeds.
My sister made this last night. It's one of her go-to mid-week dinners, and is SO delicious. I'd use the meat for tacos or burritos! Yum!

I make it with pork shoulder or pork butt. I use 1/2 cube of unsalted butter and serve it over polenta. Delicious! Makes my mouth water just thinking about it. And so simple. Can literally be thrown together in five minutes.

I used another reviewer's recommendation to use sliced pepperoncini. I just sliced the whole ones I already had. I also added a little pepperoncini juice as well. I used a 2 pound roast and cut the rest in half. I did bump the heat up on mine since the meat was small in the crockpot, so it wasn't getting as much heat.

Loved this! But I made a mistake; I accidentally purchased banana peppers instead of pepperoncini! I didn’t even notice until I was about to pour them over the top when I started this recipe this morning! Oops! How did I miss that? Still good! Now plan to make again using the correct ingredient! Meat was very tender and very flavorful. Thank you!
I totally love this recipe. I also add potatoes and carrots after a few hours.
Excellent. I used the whole jar of sliced peppercinnis. Will make again.

I liked it well enough, the peppers were the best part, but I felt it was missing something…I will experiment more next time I make it. Maybe make the broth into a thicker gravy and serve it with mashed potatoes as well.

It is awesome. I have served it as a roast, as sandwich's shred the meat and put on a bun, and have used it for beef manhattans. Again for this one I shredded the meat. Never ever put vege's in the pot with it.
Delicious! Made as directed and it was perfect. Will add carrots and potatoes next time.
I made it. It's too salty and too rich. I needed to add oregano for flavor. I wouldn't make it again.
Delicious!! So much flavor I don’t change a thing I follow this exact and it’s always a family favorite!

Don't change a thing. My husband loved it and I served it with mashed potatoes and veggies. I didn't add any veggies to it while cooking. The next day it was great for sandwiches. I got the recipe off the NYT site and thought what strange mixes but thought I'd give it a try. Going to try it this weekend with a pork roast.

I was given a similar recipe years ago; but no butter and I find that the liquid from the meat is quite adequate, so just the pepperoncini, no juice. I use a chicken gravy packet in lieu of the au jus and call it “Chicken Fried Pot Roast”.
This came out great. Loved the flavor with the pepperoncinis! We left the pepperoncinis whole so our children would have choice if they didn't want to eat them.
WAY WAY to salty
Used a venison roast instead of beef so I had to add more butter. Served over mashed potatoes! So good!!
Very simple to make and it tastes delicious!

I add half the the juice from the peppers to help it be more tender and have more sauce. I also make it a day in advance, refrigerate it overnight. That allows you to remove a lot of the fat but leaves the flavor.
Very tasty. I shredded the leftovers and served it on hoagie rolls, with a slice of pepper jack melted on top. They loved it that way as much as with potatoes.
Made it exactly to recipe except one exception I added a packet of dry Italian seasoning. An added carrots. My grand children even love it and asked me to make it all the time?????
I used 6 oz Sliced Pepperoncini and there juice.

I have made several variations of this family favorite. My dad's favorite is the spicy version which uses an entire jar of pepperocinis and the juice. My favorite and most recent version uses a half jar of pepperocinis, sliced, without the juice, replaces the butter with an entire container of beef bone broth, uses brown gravy mix rather than au jus, and then adds an entire bag of egg noodles for the last 15 minutes of cooking time. Delicious!

Excellent! Although.... too spicy! And I didn't even put in the pepperoncini peppers until the last 2 hours of cooking! (I needed to run out and buy them.) I did add two spoons of the pepperoncini juice since I figured I had missed out on several hours of it cooking as is. Next time, I'll add just 3 of the peppers and adjust it from there. I was really shocked at how good the ranch and aus jus dry packets together were! Thank you for a great recipe!

Like wow. This was excellent, it was spicier than I was hoping and was worried the rest of the family wouldn’t eat it...however it was polished off by everyone. I followed directions closely, used half of the pepperonis, but smoked it on the Traeger in a cast iron pan. This will be in the dinner rotation for some time!
Amazing recipe. Followed as is and just added more peppers and over mashed potatoes. Best pot roast I’ve ever had.
Easy and delicious! My family LOVED it!

I seared the roast before adding it to the crockpot. I found a jar of garlic dill pepperoncini and added the whole jar with the juice. I didn’t add the garlic pieces that were in the jar. Super tender with a little heat on the backside. Was perfect for us!
Love this!! I used half a jar of hot banana pepper rings (juice and peppers). It turned out great!
Perfect the way it is! Bold flavor that is not overwhelming. Great with rolls to sop up the juice.
I will never make any other roast again!!! So delicious!!!!!!
Wow! I was shocked at how delicious this recipe is
Delicious and easy. Used the leftovers to make beef stroganoff. Fabulous!
This was amazing and I don’t even like roasts! Like others, I sliced the pepperoncini peppers and poured in half the juice from the jar on top of the roast. It made for a great roux!

I saw so many great reviews on this I had to try it. I followed the recipe exactly including the browning, but added a little extra water for more broth at the end. This was outstanding and will be in the rotation regularly. My husband loved it as well, served it with cauliflower risotto and asparagus, a great easy meal.
One of the most delicious roasts I’ve ever had. We didn’t have ausjus do we substituted onion soup mix
I won’t go back to cooking pot roast any other way! Our family loves this recipe!
This is one best an easy roast tastes so delicious it just melts in your mouth your family will be asking for seconds a this every time you do a roast
Family loved it the first time I made it.
try something new and easy yo come .i love it
Apparently I missed that it should be a 4 lb roast. The flavor was extra strong, but good.
Making it again soon!! Very surprised at how well it turned out and how good it was!!
Made as is. Delicious

This is my third time making this melt in your mouth recipe.. I absolutely love this and it was a sensational hit with the family
It’s so worth the wait in cooking time

So easy and delish! I used regular brown gravy mix because that’s what I had at hand. I rested the roast on sweet onions. The gravy made the rices cauliflower seem like potatoes. This is a new family standard.

Oh. My. Gosh!!! This is about the best thing I have EVER mad, and the easiest! Being that I’m trying to do Keto, I didn’t add potatoes or carrots which I normally always do to a roast ( I know the recipe doesn’t call for them) but I wanted “something”. Well, what I did was add wedged cabbage the last hour along with some halved mushrooms and at serving time spooned the juice on top.... to die for!!! I also subbed onion soup mix for the ranch as that was what I had, and only used maybe a third of a package of it as well as the au jus.... it was perfect!

This is sooo good! I used a whole stick of butter on a 4 lb top round roast. I shredded it after 7 hours and served it on flour tortillas sprinkled with shredded cheddar cheese! Everyone loved it. Probably making this at least once a month! It would make wonderful party food!
Needed more ranch and more peppers. Other than that it was great!
Absolutely delicious and tender!
Great recipe--good flavor--and reminiscent of "Pepperoncini Beef" from this site that has become a family favorite!
This is an easy recipe and tastes fantastic. I have not cooked a roast any other way in over a year because it's that good.
Very good made it for a dinner and it was praised best roast ever
with or without peppers . best ever
Fabulous!!!
Very easy recipe to follow and the results was great. I paired it with whipped garlic potatoes and sweet corn. Will make it again.

I serve this roast at least ever 2 months, it is so good and I now buy at least a 3 pound roast so we have leftovers. Freeze leftovers and reheat and it's as good as the day you made it and that's REally good. It's has almost totally replaced the old tried and true pot roast.
This is an excellent recipe! I followed it exactly and it turned out absolutely delicious. Served with mashed potatoes, buttered corn, and salad. Definitely will make again!
Phenomenal flavor , family favorite.

This recipe turned out great! I also added a Lipton dry onion mix, which added some nice texture bits to the au jus. Also added a splash of the vinegar from my jar of peppers, because I was worried there wouldn’t be enough water, but everything came out great! I served this with mashed potatoes, rice pilaf, and a side of asparagus, with King’s Hawaiian rolls. The meat is really a great base, the leftovers can be made into tacos, burritos, to a pasta, definitely a new family staple.

Incredible flavor!!! I did as someone else did and added some beef broth, mushrooms and onion. We love mushrooms and it’s that time of year on the Oregon Coast. I served it over some brown rice with quinoa. One of my new favorite Crock Pot meals!
Super good! Whole family raves about it. I did braised the meat first before I threw it in the crockpot. I threw in some whole little red potatoes.
I make this recipe as written except for using half the butter and only about a third of the packet of au jus mix and it taste just as good only a bit healthier.
When I first found this recipe I thought no way. WAY!! This is a really great tasting meal.
I’ve been making this for years! It’s one of our favorites ! Shred it during last half hour and serve over garlic mashed. I’ve also used pork roast and it’s good too!
It was tasty but very salty!! Maybe half packet of ranch instead!! 8 hours on high because I had it 6 hours on high and was still pink?
I served this with mashed potatoes and corn. My family loved it! Thank you for another great recipe.
This pot roast is our favorite dinner. No other pot roast compares! We wouldn't change a thing. We always recommend it.
I made 2lbs so I used 1/2 the butter , ranch and ya jus. Added 1/4 cup of water
Fabulous! I made it exact to the recipe. Will make again. The one change I will do is to search for a lower sodium Audi’s and ranch mix. The recipe as is, is very salty
I used french onion mix and one whole stick of butter. MMM MMM GOOD!
This was fantastic with CHICKEN over rice!!!
Turned out perfectly, although I didn't use pepperoncini peppers.

OMG... I will never make pot roast any other way! So good. I added a few splashes of the peperoncini juice to it as well. It makes it really tangy and savory! Over mashed potatoes to cut that salty tangy-ness, MMmmm!
I’ve been making this for years and we love it! I also throw in some potatoes and carrots to the crockpot! The juices make them taste amazing!!

I've made this so many times. I use the recipe as written, but if you are not cooking it til pull apart and shredding it and mixing with juices you are doing it wrong.Shred it and put over mashed potatoes or rice or just put it on a good hard roll with or without cheese. The best recipe ever.
Great taste!!!

My family love this recipe and it has become one of our favorites. The only change I made was that I put some beef broth around the roast and then put the pepercinis in the broth to cook. This roast has a great flavor
Absolutely delicious!! I made this for the first time and it was the best pot roast I have ever made!

I use one stick of butter, 1 packet of au jus, 1 packet of ranch powder and a handful of the peppers and about a 1/4c of the juice from peppers. I shred the roast about an hour prior to eating and let it soak in the liquid. I’ve made the liquid into gravy too if you prefer! Delicious!!
i loved this but a few people said it was to salty. i myself thought it was fabulous! ill see what i can do next time to keep the salt down

This is a delicious recipe! It's so easy anyone can do it. Great for beginning slow cooker users or cooks in general. I always add some juice from the peppers even though you dont have to. I like to serve it with mashed potatoes.
I've made this twice. Once time with all the butter, and another time with only 1 tsp of butter on top of seasoning. They were both delicious. I don't think you need all the butter.

This is one of our favorite roast recipes it is so easy I pour in the juice from the
pepperoncini also.
Everything went very well. Very easy to understand
my new favorite
Was very good. We like the pork one too.
Super easy and great on it's own. But so versatile, put it over egg noodles, rice or on a brioche roll with carmelized onions and blue cheese. Yum!
Use more peppers!
